A Vigorous Process of Sanctification 

     When Christ and heaven are the themes of contemplation, the conversation will give evidence of the fact. The speech will be seasoned with grace, and 
                                                                           428
the speaker will show that he has been obtaining an education in the school of the divine Teacher. Says the psalmist, "I have chosen the way of truth: Thy judgments have I laid before me," He treasured the word of God. It found an entrance to his understanding, not to be disregarded, but to be practiced in his life. . . .
